metadata.label: Mid-Level Full Stack Engineer
metadata.description: Experienced full stack engineer (3-7 years) targeting senior/staff engineer roles at top companies

hero.title: Your personalized roadmap to land a Senior Full Stack Engineer role is ready!

skillsGap.title: Understand Where You Stand Right Now
skillsGap.description: See what you have mastered and what you need to level up to senior/staff roles.

highPriority.description: Design and build distributed systems with service-to-service communication, API gateways, service mesh
Redis, CDN, multi-layer caching, cache invalidation patterns, distributed caching
Distributed tracing, logging aggregation, metrics collection (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack)
Technology evaluation, trade-off analysis, RFC writing, architectural patterns (CQRS, Event Sourcing)
Query optimization, indexing strategies, sharding, replication, read replicas, connection pooling

mediumPriority.description: RabbitMQ, Kafka, pub/sub patterns, event sourcing, dead letter queues
Code refactoring strategies, legacy migration, incremental improvements, technical roadmap planning
OWASP Top 10, OAuth 2.0, JWT security, SQL injection prevention, API rate limiting
Frontend profiling, backend optimization, load testing, CDN strategies, lazy loading
Jenkins, GitHub Actions, deployment strategies (blue-green, canary), infrastructure as code

lowPriority.description: Container orchestration, service scaling, health checks, rolling deployments
GraphQL schema design, query optimization, federation, Apollo Server

phases.title: Foundation: Microservices & Distributed Systems
phases.description: Master microservices architecture and distributed system design patterns

learningPoints.title: Microservices Fundamentals
learningPoints.description: Break down monoliths, design bounded contexts, inter-service communication patterns

learningPoints.title: Distributed Data Management
learningPoints.description: Handle data consistency across services, implement saga patterns, manage distributed transactions

learningPoints.title: Service Resilience
learningPoints.description: Circuit breakers, retry mechanisms, timeouts, bulkheads, graceful degradation

learningPoints.title: Monitoring & Debugging
learningPoints.description: Distributed tracing, correlation IDs, centralized logging, metrics collection

target.description: Design and build a multi-service system with service mesh, API gateway, and distributed tracing

whyItMatters: Microservices are the standard at all top tech companies
Required skill for senior engineer roles
Shows understanding of system complexity and scalability
Critical for handling millions of users

phases.title: Advanced: Full Stack Architecture & Performance
phases.description: Deep dive into advanced caching, performance optimization, and architectural patterns

learningPoints.title: Multi-Layer Caching
learningPoints.description: Implement CDN, application cache (Redis), database cache, cache invalidation strategies

learningPoints.title: Database Scaling Patterns
learningPoints.description: Sharding, replication, read replicas, connection pooling, query optimization

learningPoints.title: Event-Driven Architecture
learningPoints.description: Kafka, RabbitMQ, pub/sub patterns, event sourcing, CQRS, saga patterns

learningPoints.title: Performance Engineering
learningPoints.description: Frontend optimization, backend profiling, load testing, capacity planning

target.description: Build a scalable real-time collaboration app with caching, event sourcing, and sub-100ms response times

whyItMatters: Performance optimization separates senior from mid-level engineers
Critical for high-scale systems serving millions of users
Shows deep technical understanding and architectural thinking

phases.title: Leadership: Tech Leadership & Interview Mastery
phases.description: Develop tech leadership skills, architectural decision-making, and ace senior-level interviews

learningPoints.title: Architecture & Decision Making
learningPoints.description: Evaluate technologies, write RFCs, make trade-off decisions, design for scale

learningPoints.title: Tech Debt & Legacy Systems
learningPoints.description: Prioritize tech debt, plan migrations, refactor incrementally, balance features vs improvements

learningPoints.title: Mentorship & Code Quality
learningPoints.description: Conduct effective code reviews, mentor junior engineers, establish coding standards

learningPoints.title: Interview Preparation
learningPoints.description: Master hard system design problems, demonstrate leadership experience, communicate technical decisions

target.description: Complete 20+ hard system design problems, prepare leadership stories, polish technical portfolio

whyItMatters: Senior roles require leadership beyond just coding
Decision-making ability is critical for senior engineers
Mentorship and code quality ownership are expected
Interview bar is significantly higher for senior roles

companiesInsight.title: Where You Can Land
companiesInsight.description: Top companies actively hiring senior full stack engineers

companyTypes.label: Big Tech Companies
companyTypes.description: Google, Microsoft, Meta - Best in class infrastructure, massive scale, top compensation

fit.message: Strong fit - Your experience level is perfect for senior roles at top tech companies

whyFit: Big tech actively hires senior full stack engineers
Work on products serving billions of users
whatToDo: Master advanced system design (design for 1B+ users)

rounds.name: Initial Phone Screen
rounds.description: Quick coding and system design discussion

rounds.name: Coding Round 1
points: Solve hard problems with optimal solutions

rounds.name: Coding Round 2
rounds.description: Full stack implementation or distributed system problem

rounds.name: System Design Round
points: Design for billions of users and petabytes of data
Handle failure scenarios and capacity planning

rounds.name: Leadership & Behavioral
points: Share concrete examples of technical leadership
Discuss mentoring and code review experiences
Demonstrate impact on team and product
Show conflict resolution and collaboration skills

rounds.name: Hiring Manager Round
rounds.description: Team fit, role expectations, technical vision
points: Discuss your technical interests and strengths
Ask thoughtful questions about team challenges

companyTypes.label: Unicorn Startups
companyTypes.description: High-growth unicorns - Exceptional compensation, fast-paced, high impact

fit.message: Perfect fit - Unicorns need experienced engineers to scale rapidly

whyFit: Unicorns aggressively hire senior full stack engineers
Equity can be extremely valuable (10-100x potential)
Massive impact on product and business
Rapid career growth to staff/principal roles
whatToDo: Master system design for high-scale scenarios
Study their tech stack and architecture

rounds.name: Full Stack Deep Dive
rounds.description: Build a complex full stack feature end-to-end
points: Design API contracts and database schemas
Implement frontend with proper state management
Handle error cases and edge conditions

rounds.name: System Design Round
rounds.description: Design their actual product or similar system
points: Design for millions of concurrent users

rounds.name: Leadership & Culture Fit
points: Show bias for action and experimentation

rounds.name: Founder/CTO Round
points: Discuss complex technical challenges you've solved

companyTypes.label: Scaled Startups (Series B-D)
companyTypes.description: Established startups scaling rapidly - Strong mentorship, good compensation, high impact

fit.message: Excellent fit - Scaled startups need senior engineers to build robust systems

whyFit: Senior full stack engineers are highly sought after
Rapid progression to tech lead/architect roles

rounds.name: Architectural Deep Dive
rounds.description: Discuss past projects and architectural decisions

rounds.name: Team Fit Round
points: Ask about team culture and challenges

companyTypes.label: Established Product Companies
companyTypes.description: Companies like Adobe, Salesforce - Stable, mature products, strong engineering culture

fit.message: Good fit - Product companies value experienced engineers for mature systems

whyFit: Stable companies with mature engineering practices
Work on established products serving millions
whatToDo: Demonstrate code quality and testing expertise
Study their product and technical challenges

rounds.name: Phone Screen
points: Show understanding of their product domain

rounds.name: System Design Round
rounds.description: Design a system related to their product

projects.title: Build Advanced Real-World Projects
projects.description: Projects to demonstrate senior-level full stack capabilities and architectural thinking

projects.title: Multi-Tenant SaaS Backend
projects.description: Build a multi-tenant SaaS platform backend supporting multiple isolated tenants with separate databases/schemas, role-based access control, and tenant-specific customizations
technicalRequirements: Implement row-level security or separate schemas
Implement usage tracking and billing hooks
projects.interviewFlex: Demonstrates understanding of complex SaaS architecture - strong talking point for senior interviews

projects.title: Scalable Real-Time Collaboration App
projects.description: Build a Google Docs-like real-time collaboration system with operational transformation/CRDT, persistent storage, conflict resolution, and sub-second synchronization
technicalRequirements: Add comprehensive error handling and recovery
projects.interviewFlex: Shows mastery of complex distributed systems and real-time architectures - top-tier interview showcase

projects.title: Microservices E-Commerce Platform
projects.description: Build a complete e-commerce platform with microservices (products, orders, payments, inventory, notifications) with async communication, distributed transactions, and comprehensive observability
technicalRequirements: 5+ independent services with clear bounded contexts
Implement saga pattern for distributed transactions
API gateway with rate limiting and authentication
Implement circuit breakers and retry mechanisms
projects.interviewFlex: Demonstrates staff-level architectural thinking - perfect for senior/staff engineer interviews at top companies

interviewPrep.title: Senior-Level Interview Preparation Guide
systemDesignTopics: Design Instagram/Twitter feed (with caching and personalization)
Design Uber/Lyft (real-time matching and location tracking)
Design Google Drive/Dropbox (file storage and sync)
Design notification system (push notifications at scale)

algorithms: Advanced data structures (tries, segment trees, union-find)
Graph algorithms (shortest path, MST, topological sort)
systemDesign: Load balancing and API gateway patterns

courses.title: Advanced System Design for Experienced Engineers

mockInterviews.focus: System design, coding, and leadership rounds

checklist: Study message queues and event-driven architecture
Add conflict resolution and offline sync
Implement saga pattern and event sourcing
